SEARCH
Package utils.IO

Class Writer

java.lang.Object
utils.IO.Writer
public class Writer extends Object
Writer is a utility class that provides static methods for writing various types of objects to file. It currently supports writing users, requests and projects to files. Each write method takes in a file path and an ArrayList of the corresponding objects to be written to file.
Since:
2023-04-15
Version:
1.0
Author:
Esther Teo Gek Wat

  • Constructor Details

    • Writer

      public Writer()

  • Method Details

    • writeUsers

      public static void writeUsers(String fpath, ArrayList<User> masterUsers)
      Writes the list of users to file at the specified file path. The format of each line in the file is as follows: [name][email][password][type][registeredProject] where [type] is one of "Supervisor", "Coordinator" or "Student", and [registeredProject] is only present for Student users.
      Parameters:
      fpath - the file path to retrieve the user.txt file where the users will be written
      masterUsers - the list of User objects to be written to file

    • writeRequests

      public static void writeRequests(String fpath, ArrayList<Request> masterRequests)
      Writes the list of requests to file at the specified file path. The format of each line in the file is as follows: [type][status][date][projectID][requesteeID]_[updatedValue] where [type] specifies what request it is, and [status] is one of "Pending", "Approved" or "Rejected".
      Parameters:
      fpath - the file path to retrieve the request.txt file where the requests will be written
      masterRequests - the list of Request objects to be written to file

    • writeProjects

      public static void writeProjects(String fpath, ArrayList<Project> masterProjects)
      Writes the list of projects to file at the specified file path. The format of each line in the file is as follows: [projectID][supervisorID][studentID][projectTitle][projectStatus][createdBy] where [projectStatus] specifies whether a project is "allocated", "unavailable", "reserved" or "available" and [createdBy] is the supervisor ID that created the project
      Parameters:
      fpath - the file path where the projects will be written
      masterProjects - the list of Project objects to be written to file
